description: Forty-three people were killed in Jersey and Guernsey by German bombs dropped in the 1940 air raids.
title: Guernsey and Jersey mark 80 years since harbour bombings
title_page: Guernsey and Jersey mark 80 years since harbour bombings - BBC News
maintext: Graham Bree, who was just a child when the island was attacked, said: "We were having supper when we heard the noise, the disturbance, which was the planes coming over La Rocque and we went into the back garden at home.
